DataElement.preferredName: Biological Maintenance Therapy Discontinued Prior Recurrent Disease Diagnosis Biological Maintenance Therapy Discontinued Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: information related to the discontinuation of the biologic therapy used as a continuation of treatment for an extended period of time to prevent relapse prior to the recognition of the presence of the return of a disease after a period of remission.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Biological Maintenance Therapy Discontinued Prior Recurrent Disease Diagnosis
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the discontinuation of the biologic therapy used as a continuation of treatment for an extended period of time to prevent relapse prior to the recognition of the presence of the return of a disease after a period of remission.

Continuation of treatment for an extended period of time to prevent relapse.

Property.preferredDefinition: Discontinued; stopped permanently or temporarily.:Earlier in time or order.:The return of a disease after a period of remission.:The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

Concepts.definition: To stop or end, permanently or temporarily.
The return of a disease after a period of remission.

The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: information related to determining if the biologic therapy used as a continuation of treatment for an extended period of time to prevent relapse has stopped permanently or temporarily.

ReferenceDocuments.name: If the patient had biologic m
ReferenceDocuments.description: If the patient had biologic maintenance therapy, have at least 4 weeks elapsed since their last infusion of the biological therapy?
